greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First differences of A256530.
comment: Number of cells turned ON at n-th stage of cellular automaton of A256530.
Similar to A261695 which shares infinitely many terms.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Catalog of Toothpick and Cellular Automata Sequences in the OEIS
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: With the positive terms written as an irregular triangle in which the row lengths are the terms of A011782 the sequence begins:
The terma of the rows that start with 12 are also the initial terms of A073762, except the last term of every row, hence rows converge to A073762.
program: (GWBASIC) 10' a256531 First 2^z-1 positive terms: 20 z=6: defdbl a: for i=1 to z: for j=0 to 2^(i-1)-1: n=n+1: a(n)=(2^i-1)^2 + 3*(2*j)^2: print a(n)-a(n-1);: next j: next i: end
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Apr 21 2015
